tests.sic.rnqt.nbin

Class RnQTCnbin

  • java.lang.Object
    • tests.sic.rnqt.nbin.RnQTCnbin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, FunctionIntf

    public class RnQTCnbin
extends java.lang.Object
implements FunctionIntf
    function implements the continuous-time long-run expected cost of a periodic review, single echelon inventory control system facing exogenous demands generated in a period of length T, from a Negative Binomial process with parameters λ>0, p_l>0. The system faces linear holding and backorder costs with cost rates h>0, p>0. It also faces fixed costs: fixed review cost per period Kr≥0, and fixed order cost Ko≥0. Finally, there is a constant lead-time for each order being placed equal to L≥0. The control parameters then, are r (the reorder point), Q (the batch size), and T (the review interval). The code below uses the formulae 5-20, 5-22...5-24, 5-27...5-5-29 and 5-33 in the Hadley-Whittin (1963) textbook "Analysis of Inventory Systems". Numerical integration is performed for backorders costs estimation, as there are no closed form formulae easily available. The analysis package of the popt4jlib library is used for this purpose.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2019

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static double bP(int s, int Q, double T, double L, double lambda, double p)
      computes the average long-run expected back-order costs of a single-echelon system facing demands that follow the Negative Binomial (ie compound Poisson) distribution with arrival rate lambda and process parameter of the Logarithmic distribution p, with an (r,nQ,T) periodic-review policy, taking into account fixed costs (review and ordering costs).

      evaluate the long-run expected cost of a single echelon inventory control system facing Negative Binomial demands with linear holding and backorder costs and fixed backorder cost as well, and fixed review and order costs controlled by (r,nQ,T) periodic review policy.

      evaluate the long-run expected cost of a single echelon inventory control system facing demands distributed according to the Negative Binomial probability distribution, with linear holding and backorder costs and fixed review and order costs controlled by (r,nQ,T) periodic review policy.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RnQTCnbin

        public RnQTCnbin(double Kr,
                 double Ko,
                 double L,
                 double lambda,
                 double pl,
                 double h,
                 double p)
        Function sole public constructor.
        Parameters:
        Kr - double the fixed review cost (per review)
        Ko - double the fixed ordering cost (per order)
        L - double the lead-time
        lambda - double the arrival rate of the Negative Binomial distribution
        pl - double the process parameter of the Logarithmic distribution of the Nbin (viewed as compound Poisson)
        h - double linear holding cost rate
        p - double linear backorder penalty cost rate

    • Method Detail

      • eval

        public double eval(java.lang.Object x,
                   java.util.HashMap param)
        evaluate the long-run expected cost of a single echelon inventory control system facing Negative Binomial demands with linear holding and backorder costs and fixed backorder cost as well, and fixed review and order costs controlled by (r,nQ,T) periodic review policy.
        Specified by:
        eval in interface FunctionIntf
        Parameters:
        x - double[] representing r (order up-to point), Q (batch size), and T (review period length)
        param - HashMap if not null, it may contain value for the Kr parameter
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - unchecked if the computations go awry, see method evalBoth(x).

      • evalBoth

        Pair evalBoth(java.lang.Object x,
              java.util.HashMap param)
        evaluate the long-run expected cost of a single echelon inventory control system facing demands distributed according to the Negative Binomial probability distribution, with linear holding and backorder costs and fixed review and order costs controlled by (r,nQ,T) periodic review policy. It returns in a pair of doubles, both the actual value as well as the value when the order cost Ko is zero, forming a lower bound on the cost function.
        Parameters:
        x - double[] or popt4jlib.DblArray1Vector representing r, Q and T
        param - HashMap // may contain a <"Ko",$val> pair
        Returns:
        utils.Pair // Pair<Double result, Double lowerbound>
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - unchecked if Po is computed outside [0,1] or if any number computed turns out to be Double.NaN.

      • bP

        public static double bP(int s,
                        int Q,
                        double T,
                        double L,
                        double lambda,
                        double p)
        computes the average long-run expected back-order costs of a single-echelon system facing demands that follow the Negative Binomial (ie compound Poisson) distribution with arrival rate lambda and process parameter of the Logarithmic distribution p, with an (r,nQ,T) periodic-review policy, taking into account fixed costs (review and ordering costs).
        Parameters:
        s - int order-up to point
        Q - int batch-size
        T - double review period length
        L - double lead-time
        lambda - double arrival rate of Nbin distribution
        p - double process parameter for Nbin distribution
        Returns:
        double back-orders part of the total cost

        public static double gc(double x)
        returns the value of the mathematical Gamma function at x. Uses a thread- local cache to look-up values that may have been computed before.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        double
        Throws:

      • integrate

        public static double integrate(FunctionIntf f,
                               double a,
                               double b)
        helper static method to allow the integration of the function f according to its 1st variable in the interval [a,b]. The function f must accept VectorIntf argument as input. The requested accuracy is _INTEGRAL_APPROX_EPS.
        Parameters:
        f - FunctionIntf
        a - double the left end of the interval.
        b - double the right end of the interval
        Returns:
        double the result of applying Simpson rule for integration.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        invoke as java -cp <classpath> tests.sic.rnqt.nbin.RnQTCnbin <r> <Q> <T> <Kr> <Ko> <L> <λ> <p_l> <h> <p>. The constraints on the variables and parameters values are as follows:
        • T>0
        • λ>0
        • p_l>0
        • h>0
        • p>0
        All numbers (except r) must be non-negative. The reorder point variable r may take any integer value; the batch size Q may take any positive integer value.
        Parameters:
        args - String[]
